components.description: The Multipart Message component creates a multipart message to be used as a payload of the REST Client. A multipart message can be defined to contain text only or binary parts. A not empty part name is mandatory for each part defined inside 'Multipart message parts' map. Parts with an empty name will be ignored.

properties.name: parts
properties.description: A map containing mappings between part names and part definitions.

objectProperties.name: content
objectProperties.description: Sets the content of the current part object. It could be a static (text only) value or a dynamic value.

objectProperties.name: mimeType
objectProperties.description: Sets the mime type of the part object.

components.description: Use this component to make a REST API Call. Supported REST methods are: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS. The base REST Client configuration can be shared across multiple REST clients in case there is a common remote resource to make different requests to. The components supports basic an digest authentication with the remote server.

objectProperties.name: protocol
objectProperties.description: The http protocol to be used in the request. Possible values are: HTTPHTTPS.

objectProperties.name: host
objectProperties.description: Sets the remote host the HTTP request will be sent to.

objectProperties.name: port
objectProperties.description: Sets the remote port the HTTP request will be sent to.

objectProperties.name: basePath
objectProperties.description: Sets the base request path for all listeners using this configuration.

objectProperties.name: requestTimeout
objectProperties.description: Returns the timeout in milliseconds used when requesting a connection from the connection manager. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

objectProperties.name: connectTimeout
objectProperties.description: Determines the timeout in milliseconds until a connection is established.

objectProperties.name: socketTimeout
objectProperties.description: Defines the socket timeout in milliseconds, which is the timeout for waiting for data or, put differently, a maximum period inactivity between two consecutive data packets.

objectProperties.name: maxPoolConnections
objectProperties.description: Max connections to be kept in the connection pool for all the requests to the given host.

objectProperties.name: trustCertificates
objectProperties.description: If true, all requests to a host with a self signed certificate are not verified.

objectProperties.name: followRedirects
objectProperties.description: If true, HTTP responses with redirects codes 3xx (301, 308) are automatically followed.

objectProperties.name: expectContinue
objectProperties.description: If true, sends Expect: 100-continue header in the initial request before sending the body.

objectProperties.name: keepAlive
objectProperties.description: If true keeps the TCP connection open for multiple HTTP requests/responses.

objectProperties.name: authentication
objectProperties.description: Specifies the type of authentication to be performed on the remote server. Possible values are: NONE, BASIC, DIGEST.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: The username to be used in the remote server basic authentication.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The password to be used in the remote server basic authentication.

objectProperties.name: preemptive
objectProperties.description: Immediately sends basic authentication header before the server answers with unauthorized response code.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: The username to be used in the remote server digest authentication.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The password to be used in the remote server digest authentication.

objectProperties.name: preemptive
objectProperties.description: Immediately sends digest authentication header before the server answers with unauthorized response code.

objectProperties.name: realm
objectProperties.description: Realm value to be used in the digest authentication.

objectProperties.name: nonce
objectProperties.description: Nonce value to be used in the digest authentication if known.

objectProperties.name: proxy
objectProperties.description: Enables or disable the use of proxy. Possible values are: NONE, PROXY.

objectProperties.name: host
objectProperties.description: The proxy host name.

objectProperties.name: port
objectProperties.description: The proxy port.

objectProperties.name: authentication
objectProperties.description: The proxy authentication scheme to use. Possible values are: NONE, BASIC, DIGEST.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: The username to be used in the basic proxy authentication.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The password to be used in the basic proxy authentication.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: The username to be used in the digest proxy authentication.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The password to be used in the digest proxy authentication.

properties.name: baseURL
properties.description: The base URL of the HTTP request. It may include a static request path.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The request path might contain parameters placeholders which will be bound to the values defined in the Headers and parameters > Path params map.

properties.name: method
properties.description: The REST method to be used to make the request. Possible values are: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Sets the payload of the HTTP request. It could be a dynamic or a static value.

properties.name: streaming
properties.description: Determines the strategy type the body will be sent to the server. When Stream the request body will be sent chunk by chunk without loading the entire content into memory. When None the body will be loaded into memory and then sent to the server. When Auto the component will inspect the content of the body to determine the best strategy to send the HTTP request data.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: Map of dynamic headers names > values. The values are dynamic.

properties.name: pathParameters
properties.description: Map of request path parameters names > values. The values are dynamic.

properties.name: queryParameters
properties.description: Map of request query parameters names > values. The values are dynamic.

properties.name: target
properties.description: If the property is not empty, the result of the REST Client execution is assigned to the given context variable instead of the message payload.

objectProperties.name: responseBufferSize
objectProperties.description: The buffer size to be used while receiving the HTTP response.

objectProperties.name: requestBufferSize
objectProperties.description: The buffer size to be used while sending the HTTP request.

components.description: The REST Listener can be used to create a REST endpoint listening on a given port, post and path. The listening path might contain path segments which are matched whenever an HTTP request comes in. A REST Listener configuration might be shared across different REST Listener whenever there is a need to reuse a common endpoint configuration across different REST resources. The REST Listener is an Inbound component and it can only be placed at the beginning of a flow.

objectProperties.name: protocol
objectProperties.description: The http protocol to use. Possible values are: HTTP, HTTPS.

objectProperties.name: host
objectProperties.description: The host this REST listener will be bound to.

objectProperties.name: port
objectProperties.description: The port this REST listener will be bound to.

objectProperties.name: basePath
objectProperties.description: The base path shared by all the listeners using this configuration.

objectProperties.name: readTimeoutMillis
objectProperties.description: Sets the socket read timeout for this listener in milliseconds.

objectProperties.name: connectionTimeoutMillis
objectProperties.description: Sets the socket connection timeout for this listener in milliseconds.

objectProperties.name: socketBacklog
objectProperties.description: The number of pending connections the listener queue will hold.

objectProperties.name: maxChunkSize
objectProperties.description: The maximum length of the content of each chunk.

objectProperties.name: maxLengthOfAllHeaders
objectProperties.description: The maximum length of all headers.

objectProperties.name: compress
objectProperties.description: If true the response is compressed before sending it to the client.

objectProperties.name: disableOpenApi
objectProperties.description: If true, open API is not exposed for all endpoints using this REST Listener Configuration.

objectProperties.name: keepAlive
objectProperties.description: Enables socket keep alive for this listener.

objectProperties.name: type
objectProperties.description: Specifies the server security type. Possible values are: CERTIFICATE_AND_PRIVATE_KEY, KEY_STORE.

objectProperties.name: certificateFile
objectProperties.description: The path on the filesystem to the certificate file.

objectProperties.name: privateKeyFile
objectProperties.description: The path on the filesystem to the private key.

objectProperties.name: path
objectProperties.description: The path on the filesystem of the key store.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The keystore password.

objectProperties.name: type
objectProperties.description: The keystore type.

objectProperties.name: algorithm
objectProperties.description: The keystore algorithm.

objectProperties.name: useTrustStore
objectProperties.description: If true the given trust store is used.

objectProperties.name: path
objectProperties.description: The path on the filesystem of the trust store.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: The trust store password.

objectProperties.name: type
objectProperties.description: The trust store type.

objectProperties.name: algorithm
objectProperties.description: The trust store algorithm.

objectProperties.name: title
objectProperties.description: The title of the API.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: A short description of the API.

objectProperties.name: termsOfService
objectProperties.description: A URL to the Terms of Service for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.

objectProperties.name: version
objectProperties.description: The version of the API.

objectProperties.name: name
objectProperties.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

objectProperties.name: url
objectProperties.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. MUST be in the format of a URL.

objectProperties.name: email
objectProperties.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. MUST be in the format of an email address.

objectProperties.name: name
objectProperties.description: The license name used for the API.

objectProperties.name: url
objectProperties.description: A URL to the license used for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.

objectProperties.name: schema
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: url
objectProperties.description: A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the location where the OpenAPI document is being served. Variable substitutions will be made when a variable is named in {brackets}.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: An optional string describing the host designated by the URL.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: An optional description for the server variable.

objectProperties.name: defaultValue
objectProperties.description: The default value to use for substitution, and to send, if an alternate value is not supplied. Unlike the Schema Object's default, this value MUST be provided by the consumer.

objectProperties.name: enumValues
objectProperties.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The rest path this listener will be bound to. If present must start with '/'. The path might contain regexp, e.g: /{name:.*} which would match against anything it is compared to, or parameters /{group}/{id}. Path parameters are bound to a map in the out message attributes. The following script expression can be used to retrieve request path parameters: message.attributes().pathParams.

properties.name: method
properties.description: The REST Method this listener will be listening from.

properties.name: streaming
properties.description: Determines the way the response body is sent to the client. When set to Auto and if the size of the payload is not clear, e.g. it is a stream of data, then it uses Transfer-Encoding: chunked when sending data back to the client. Otherwise Content-Length encoding with the size of the payload is used. When set to Always Transfer-Encoding: chunked is always used, and when none Content-Length is always used instead.

objectProperties.name: body
objectProperties.description: The body of the response might be a static or a dynamic value.

objectProperties.name: status
objectProperties.description: The status code of the response might be a static or a dynamic value, e.g. could be a variable defined in the flow context: context.myResponseStatus.

objectProperties.name: headers
objectProperties.description: Additional headers to be set in the HTTP response.

objectProperties.name: body
objectProperties.description: The body of the error response might be a static or a dynamic value.

objectProperties.name: status
objectProperties.description: The status code of the error response might be a static or a dynamic value, e.g. could be a variable defined in the flow context: context.myErrorResponseStatus.

objectProperties.name: headers
objectProperties.description: Additional headers to be set in the HTTP error response.

objectProperties.name: exclude
objectProperties.description: Excludes this endpoint from being published in the OpenAPI document.

objectProperties.name: deprecated
objectProperties.description: Declares this operation to be deprecated. Consumers SHOULD refrain from usage of the declared operation.

objectProperties.name: summary
objectProperties.description: A short summary of what the operation does.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.example: Updates an order in the store with JSON data
objectProperties.hintValue: Updates an order in the store with JSON data
objectProperties.description: A verbose explanation of the operation behavior.

objectProperties.name: operationId
objectProperties.description: Unique string used to identify the operation. The id MUST be unique among all operations described in the API. Tools and libraries MAY use the operationId to uniquely identify an operation, therefore, it is RECOMMENDED to follow common programming naming conventions.

objectProperties.name: required
objectProperties.description: Determines if the request body is required in the request.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: A brief description of the request body. This could contain examples of use.

objectProperties.name: example
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: schema
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: A short description of the response.

objectProperties.name: example
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: schema
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: A brief description of the header. This could contain examples of use.

objectProperties.name: style
objectProperties.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form.

objectProperties.name: example
objectProperties.description: Example of the parameter's potential value. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present.

objectProperties.name: explode
objectProperties.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false.

objectProperties.name: deprecated
objectProperties.description: Specifies that a parameter is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage.

objectProperties.name: allowReserved
objectProperties.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query.

objectProperties.name: name
objectProperties.description: The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive. If in is 'Path', the name field MUST correspond to a template expression occurring within the path field in the Paths Object. For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name used by the in property.

objectProperties.name: description
objectProperties.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.

objectProperties.name: in
objectProperties.description: The location of the parameter. Possible values are 'query', 'header', 'path' or 'cookie'.

objectProperties.name: style
objectProperties.description: Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value. Default values (based on value of in): for query - form; for path - simple; for header - simple; for cookie - form.

objectProperties.name: example
objectProperties.description: Example of the parameter's potential value. The example SHOULD match the specified schema and encoding properties if present.

objectProperties.name: explode
objectProperties.description: When this is true, parameter values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value of the array or key-value pair of the map. For other types of parameters this property has no effect. When style is form, the default value is true. For all other styles, the default value is false.

objectProperties.name: deprecated
objectProperties.description: Specifies that a parameter is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage.

objectProperties.name: required
objectProperties.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false.

objectProperties.name: allowEmptyValue
objectProperties.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for query parameters and allows sending a parameter with an empty value.

objectProperties.name: allowReserved
objectProperties.description: Determines whether the parameter value SHOULD allow reserved characters, as defined by RFC3986 :/?#[]@!$&'()*+,;= to be included without percent-encoding. This property only applies to parameters with an in value of query.

autocompleteItems.description: Adds a new attribute with the given key and value to the part object.
Sets binary data to the current part object. Default mime type is 'application/octet-stream'.
Sets text data to the current part object. Default mime type is 'text/plain'.
Sets binary data to the current part object with the given mime type.
Sets text data to the current part object with the given mime type.
Creates an HttpPart object with the configured settings.

autocompleteTypes.description: An HttpPart object encapsulates an HTTP part to be used in HTTP Multipart requests/responses. The HTTP listener payload contains a map of HttpPart objects whenever a POST request has 'multipart/form-data' content type. A map of HttpPart objects can be used as an input of a REST Client component to make multipart HTTP requests.
The HttpPartBuilder creates new HttpPart objects.
